mapping

Class TileMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • mapping.TileMap

  • public class TileMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores a map as 2-dimensional field of tiles. The class processes the drawing of the combination of tiles. It also provides access to the tiles.

    Changes: The class now supports the emptying of tiles and the unlocking of doors.

    Total Time Spent: 2 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

      The TileMap, represented as a grid of Tiles.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      TileMap(java.lang.String mapName)
      Creates a TileMap by accessing the .map file associated with the name.

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int posX,
                    int posY)
        Provides access to a Tile on the TileMap.
        Parameters:
        posX - x-coordinate of the Tile
        posY - y-coordinate of the Tile
        Returns:
        The Tile at (posX, posY).

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(java.awt.Point point)
        Provides access to a Tile on the TileMap.
        Parameters:
        point - an (x,y) coordinate on the TileMap.
        Returns:
        The Tile at (point.x, point.y).

      • setTileEmpty

        public void setTileEmpty(java.awt.Point point,
                         int level)
        Makes the Tile at point an empty Tile, as specified by new Tile(' ', level);
        Parameters:
        point - the Tile being changed.
        level - the level number of the location of the Tile being changed.

      • unlockDoor

        public void unlockDoor(java.awt.Point point,
                       int level)
        Makes the closed door at point become unlocked, as specified by new Tile('d', level);
        Parameters:
        point - location of the door
        level - the level number of the location of the Tile being changed.

      • drawMap

        public java.awt.Image drawMap()
        Returns:
        An Image that represents the combinations of all the Tiles on the TileMap.

      • joinBufferedImage

        private static java.awt.image.BufferedImage joinBufferedImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img1,
                                                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage img2,
                                                              int offset,
                                                              boolean right)
        Combines two images into one.
        Parameters:
        img1 - The images on the left or top.
        img2 - The images on the right or bottom.
        offset - Distance between the two images.
        right - If true, img2 is connected at the right. If false, img2 is connected at the bottom.
        Returns:
        The image created by merging the two provided images.
